deck.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the outside top level of a ship that you can walk or sit on
deck.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: one of the different levels on a ship
deck.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: a staircase leading to the passenger deck
deck.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: one of the levels on a bus, plane etc
deck.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: I managed to find a seat on the upper deck.
Eddie returned to the flight deck (=the part of an aircraft where the pilot sits).
deck.translation[0].definitions[3].signp: at the back of a house
deck.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a wooden floor built out from the back of a house, where you can sit and relax outdoors
deck.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a piece of equipment used for playing music tapes, records etc
deck.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to decorate something with flowers, flags etc
deck.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The street was decked with flags for the royal wedding.
deck.translation[1].definitions[0].note_: Deck is usually passive in this meaning
deck.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to hit someone so hard that they fall over
deck.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Gerry just swung round and decked him.
deck.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: one of the levels on a ship
deck.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Cargo is stored on the ship’s lower deck.
